noun.description: A native or inhabitant of Podolia, a region in present-day south-western Ukraine.

adjective.description: Of or relating to a breed of cattle found mainly in Italy.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Richard Knolles (d. 1610), historian and translator. From Podolia (Russian Podolija, Ukrainian Podillja, Polish Podole; compare Old Russian Podolije, lit. valley), the name of a region in present-day south-west Ukraine + -an.
